headline.main: Mixed Reaction for Ryan at AARP Convention

docs.abstract: Representative Paul D. Ryan faced a tough and at some points hostile audience, drawing applause when he introduced his mother but eliciting boos and shouts of "No!" when he called for the repeal of Obamacare.
docs.snippet: Representative Paul D. Ryan faced a tough and at some points hostile audience, drawing applause when he introduced his mother but eliciting boos and shouts of "No!" when he called for the repeal of Obamacare.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Romney's Health Plan Would Have Impact on Current Retirees

docs.abstract: Overturning the president's health care law, as Mr. Romney has pledged to do, could wipe out several benefits retirees are currently receiving because of the law.
docs.snippet: Overturning the president's health care law, as Mr. Romney has pledged to do, could wipe out several benefits retirees are currently receiving because of the law.

headline.main: For AARP Convention, Obama Plays Fact-Checker in Chief

docs.abstract: In his speech to the AARP convention Friday, President Obama provided some important context around one of his ads attacking Representative Paul D. Ryan's Medicare plan.
docs.snippet: In his speech to the AARP convention Friday, President Obama provided some important context around one of his ads attacking Representative Paul D. Ryan's Medicare plan.

headline.main: The High Cost of Out-of-Pocket Expenses

docs.abstract: A new study finds that out-of-pocket medical costs in the last five years of life often place a significant financial burden on individuals and families.
docs.snippet: A new study finds that out-of-pocket medical costs in the last five years of life often place a significant financial burden on individuals and families.

docs.lead_paragraph: A long rise in Americans’ life spans has reversed itself for white people who lack high school diplomas, an increasingly troubled group that has lost four years of life expectancy since 1990.

headline.seo: Life Expectancy for Less Educated Whites in U.S. Is Shrinking
headline.main: Life Spans Shrink for Least-Educated Whites in the U.S.
headline.print_headline: Reversing Trend, Life Span Shrinks for Some Whites

docs.abstract: Research study highlights mounting evidence that the enduring trend that children would outlive their parents has reversed itself for country’s least-educated whites, an increasingly troubled group whose life expectancy has fallen by four years since 1990; reasons remain unclear but some possible explanations include a spike in prescription drug overdoses and higher rates of smoking.
docs.snippet: A long rise in Americans’ life spans has reversed itself for white people who lack high school diplomas, an increasingly troubled group that has lost four years of life expectancy since 1990.

docs.lead_paragraph: Whether to discuss, report or even ask about injuries to college football players has sparked debate among coaches, especially in the Pac-12 Conference.

headline.seo: College Football Coaches Divided on Idea of Weekly Injury Reports
headline.main: College Coaches Divided on Reporting of Injuries
headline.print_headline: College Football Coaches Divided On Reporting of Players’ Injuries

docs.abstract: College football coaches, especially in the Pac-12 Conference, are divided on idea of weekly injury reports; some believe that releasing such information could lead to a competitive disadvantage.
docs.snippet: Whether to discuss, report or even ask about injuries to college football players has sparked debate among coaches, especially in the Pac-12 Conference.

docs.lead_paragraph: Joko Widodo, the mayor of Surakarta, Indonesia, has a message of change that has propelled him into the upstart contender for leader of Jakarta, one of Asia’s most important metropolises.

headline.seo: Joko Widodo Breathing New Ideas Into Jakarta Election
headline.main: Outsider Breathing New Ideas Into Jakarta Election
headline.print_headline: Outsider Breathing New Ideas Into Jakarta Election

docs.snippet: Joko Widodo, the mayor of Surakarta, Indonesia, has a message of change that has propelled him into the upstart contender for leader of Jakarta, one of Asia’s most important metropolises.

headline.main: From the Insurance Industry, a Seldom-Used Barometer of Vehicle Cost

docs.abstract: A new report from the Highway Loss Data Institute argues that collision-claims information can give a sense of the average expense of repairing a vehicle as well as how a repair can affect premiums.
docs.snippet: A new report from the Highway Loss Data Institute argues that collision-claims information can give a sense of the average expense of repairing a vehicle as well as how a repair can affect premiums.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congressional Budget Office analysts said that by 2016 nearly six million Americans would face a charge for not having insurance.

headline.seo: Estimate Rises on Health Insurance Penalty
headline.main: More Expected to Face Penalty Under Health Law
headline.print_headline: More Expected To Face Penalty In Health Law

docs.abstract: Congressional Budget Office analysts say that by 2016 nearly six million Americans will face a tax penalty under the health care reform law for not having health insurance, a significantly higher estimate that their previous projection.
docs.snippet: Congressional Budget Office analysts said that by 2016 nearly six million Americans would face a charge for not having insurance.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The flawed incentives that guide businesses’ employment practices hurt women at both ends of the labor market.

headline.seo: Low-Paid Women Want Predictable Hours and Steady Pay

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Susan J Lambert observes that the problems besetting women both at the top and the bottom of the labor market stem from flawed incentives that guide businesses' employment practices, such a flexible scheduling; contends that sweeping changes to labor laws are essential for women to achieve predictable hours and steady pay.
docs.snippet: The flawed incentives that guide businesses’ employment practices hurt women at both ends of the labor market.
